intro: Tripleurospermum phaeocephalum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in the summer months. It is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
